At renzi day [49] divination, (diviner) Zheng tested: Starting from the present day,3 we shall destroy4 the Zhou.5
(He) tested: Starting from the fifth day,6 we shall not anticipate7 that (we will) destroy the Zhou.

At guichou day [50] divination, (diviner) Zheng tested: Starting from the present, reaching till day dingsi [54], we shall destroy the Zhou. The king prognosticating said/says: “On day dingsi [54] be it not anticipated8 that we will destroy (them), (but) by9 the coming day jiazi [1] (we shall) destroy (them). (Having/making it) a (full ten-day week) cycle (and) having (in addition) one day (> i.e., after a week and one day, eleventh day), guihai [60], (the) Ju did not destroy (them, i.e.) the Zhou, (but) coming (to)10 the evening through11 (next day) jiazi [1] (we/they?) did indeed destroy (them).12
At guichou day [50] divination, (diviner) Zheng tested: Starting from the present reaching till the day dingsi [54], we shall not anticipate to destroy the Zhou.
At gengshen day [57] divination, the king tested: I shall attack (the) Bu. Third moon.
At gengshen day [57] divination, the king tested: I do not attack (do not have [them] attack, do not decide/assume to attack) the Bu.14
At gengshen day [57] divination, the king tested: I do attack/punish16 the Bu/Pei.
At gengshen day [57] divination, the king tested: I do not attack/punish the Bu/Pei.
At gengshen day [57] divination, (he) tested: (one, we)17 shall capture the Fou.
At gengshen day [57] divination, the king tested: Que, (one) shall not anticipate he will capture the Fou.19
As to Que, (one) shall not anticipate he will capture the Fou.
At xinyou day [58] divination, Gu [tested]: (On) the next day renxu [59] Bu (Pei) will arrive.
At guihai day [60] divination, Gu tested: our envoy(s) will destroy the Fou.
At guihai day [60] divination, Gu tested: our envoy(s),22 be it not anticipated23 that they will destroy the Fou.
At guihai day [60] divination, Gu tested: (On) the next day yichou [2] the many servants will destroy the Fou.
Next day yichou [2] the many servants, (one) shall not anticipate that they will destroy the Fou.
At yichou day [2] divination, Gu tested: Childe Shang, (one) shall not anticipate that he will capture the Xian.
At bingyin day [3] divination, Zheng [tested]: (One) shall call upon Long, Lao, Marquis Zhuan to afflict Bu.
Tested: Da, one shall not anticipate he will harmonize (collaborate) with the king’s affairs.
Crack making on the renzi day [49], Zheng tested : Starting from the present, in five days (or: In five days from now), we (will) (be able to) harm (or: smite) the You [ ].
Tested: Starting from [the present], in five days (or: five days from now), we might not (be able to) harm (or: smite) the You [ ].

Crack making on the guichou day [50], Zheng tested: Starting from the present down to the dingsi day (or: between now and the dingsi day), we (will be able to) harm (or: smite) the You [ ]. His Majesty, having prognosticated, declared: “(On) the dingsi day [54], we might not (be able to) harm (or: smite) (them), (but) on the coming jiazi day [1] we will (be able to) harm (or: smite) (them).” In eleven days, (on) the guihai day [60], Ju [could] not harm (or: smite) (them), (but when) that night [i.e., of the guihai day] cut into (or: intersected with) [-] the jiazi day, (we) did indeed harm (or: smite) (them).
Crack making on the guichou day [50], Zheng tested: Between now and the dingsi day [54], we might not (be able to) harm (or: smite) the You [ ].
Crack making on the gengshen day [57], His Majesty tested: I should launch an attack against the Pi [‘].13 Third month.

Crack making on the gengshen day [57], His Majesty tested: I should not launch an attack against the Pi.

Qiao might not (be able to) capture the Fou/Tao (or Bao).
Crack making on the xinyou day [58], Nan [b]21 [tested]: (On) the following renxu day [59], Pi [‘] will arrive. Second announcement [7].
Crack making on the guihai day [60], Nan [b] tested: Our (military) officer will (be able to) harm (or: smite) the Fou/Tao (or Bao). Second announcement.
Crack making on the guihai day [60], Nan tested: Our (military) officer might not (be able to) harm (or: smite) the Fou/Tao (or Bao). Second announcement [ 7].
Crack making on the guihai day [60], Nan tested: (On) the following yichou day [2] the Many Servitors will (be able to) harm (or: smite) the Fou/Tao (or Bao).
(On) the next yichou day [2] the Many Servitors might not (succeed in) harming the Fou/Tao (or Bao). ( (N.B. “succeed” = “be able to” used synonymously)
Crack making on the yichou day, Nan tested: Zi Shang [E] might not (succeed in) capturing the Xin [F]. Second announcement [7].
